explanations.B: The square root of 2 has a non-repeating and non-terminating decimal, meaning it can't be written as a fraction with an integer numerator and denominator. That means it must be irrational!
explanations.C: Remember that a calculator doesn't show you every single digit in the answer to something. It will be either rounded or truncated!
explanations.D: That would only work for perfect squares where their root is an integer, such as √4 = 2 or √9 = 3. √2 isn't a whole number.

explanations.D: Although 2 is a rational number, the square root of 2 is a non-terminating and non-repeating decimal, which means √2 itself is actually irrational.
